name: Nexus
description: Nexus is open-source, modular, and extensible, optimizing prover performance and supporting custom computations. It aims to enhance digital interactions with a focus on correctness, transparency, and security, making large-scale verifiable computing accessible and efficient.

name: Neova
description: Neova is a decentralized protocol designed to enhance data management through a decentralized infrastructure. It operates as a DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network) layer, focusing on providing secure, private, and user-friendly cloud solutions. Neova powered by @AvailProject.

name: Blockcast
description: Blockcast is a decentralized content delivery network (CDN) and marketplace that helps broadcasters increase traffic and reach wider audiences. Blockcast bridges the gap between television and online streaming by tokenizing unused TV spectrum to deliver content.

name: Aztec
description: Aztec Network is a Layer 2 solution for Ethereum that brings privacy to blockchain through zero-knowledge cryptography. With its own language, Noir, developers can build private decentralized applications where confidentiality meets verifiability. Aztec is paving the way for the next generation of secure and private Web3 experiences.

name: Drosera
description: Drosera is a decentralized incident response protocol aimed at addressing and mitigating security exploits within blockchain ecosystems. By employing a novel approach to security, Drosera introduces a mechanism where protocols can establish hidden security measures known as Traps. These Traps are smart contracts designed to remain off-chain, preserving the confidentiality of security strategies until needed.

name: Hyperspace
description: HyperspaceAI is pioneering the world's largest distributed AI network, offering a peer-to-peer system for AI computation, personalized browsing, and more. The project allows participants to run nodes using open-source AI models and earn points as rewards for contributing computational power. Key features include generating knowledge networks from authoritative sources (e.g., Wikipedia, arXiv), deep data analysis via web search and code execution, and access to an updatable vector database. Hyper.Space supports 500+ open models and scales via 17,500+ nodes, ensuring security through encryption and decentralized architecture. The project integrates blockchain for transaction efficiency and Proof-of-FLOPS (proof of computational work), positioning it as part of the Web3 and decentralized AI trend.
